normalised: Indian Railways is undertaking a massive overhaul of its signaling system to enhance safety and efficiency across its vast network. As of twenty sixth october two thousand and twenty four, the project, budgeted at rupee seventy eight thousand crore, aims to replace outdated mechanical and electro-mechanical systems with modern, centralized traffic control (C-T-C) and automatic train protection (A-T-P) systems, significantly reducing the risk of accidents.

unnormalised: The modernization drive is particularly focused on high-density corridors and routes prone to congestion. Northern Railway zone, which includes busy sections like Delhi-Kanpur, will receive a substantial portion of the investment. The installation of ATP systems, based on the European Train Control System (ETCS) Level 2 standards, will automatically prevent trains from exceeding speed limits or passing signals at danger, thus mitigating human error.
